title: X39 launch hero: subtle falling X39 rain behind horse + red glowing eyes asset

requirements.summary: Add a subtle falling “X39” rain effect behind the horse visual within the launch hero, styled like IntroScreen but lighter and motion-accessible.
acceptanceCriteria: In the right-side hero visual area (horse column) there is a visible but subtle falling “X39” (or “X” + “39”) rain effect behind the horse image.
The effect is visually similar in style to the intro text-rain (IntroScreen) but tuned to be lighter/less distracting than the intro.
The effect respects prefers-reduced-motion (disabled or rendered as a static non-animated fallback when reduced motion is enabled).
The effect does not block pointer events and does not interfere with layout on mobile or desktop.
No NaN/Infinity/render-loop issues occur; animation is cleaned up on unmount (no leaked timers/raf).

file_operations.description: Create a scoped (non-fullscreen) canvas-based “X” + “39” falling-rain backdrop component for the horse visual area, inspired by IntroScreen’s styling but with reduced opacity/density/speed; ensure pointer-events are disabled, rendering is clipped to its container, prefers-reduced-motion uses a static single-frame fallback, and requestAnimationFrame/ResizeObserver/listeners are cleaned up on unmount.

Wire the new X39HorseX39RainBackdrop into the right-side hero horse visual container as an absolutely positioned layer behind the horse image (and behind/compatible with existing glow), ensuring it doesn’t affect layout, remains subtle for copy readability, and stays non-interactive (no pointer events).

requirements.summary: Update the launch hero horse image to a new static asset version with clearly visible glowing red eyes.
acceptanceCriteria: The horse graphic used by X39MatrixLaunchHeroBlock shows distinctly visible red glowing eyes at typical viewport sizes (mobile and desktop).
Red eyes remain visible over the existing glow/drop-shadow treatments and do not appear washed out by filters.
The updated image is served as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend (no backend image serving).

file_operations.description: Add the updated generated horse artwork with clearly visible glowing red eyes at frontend/public/assets/generated/x39-code-horse-red-eyes.dim_1400x1400.png (static asset; no backend serving).

Update the horse to reference the new static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/x39-code-horse-red-eyes.dim_1400x1400.png, verifying existing drop-shadow/glow styling keeps the red eyes distinct on mobile and desktop.
